content: mini fly agaric mushroom pattern materials needed 4ply cotton yarn in beige red and white* 2 25 mm hook yarn needle stuffing *yarn brands i recommend scheepjes catona yarn and colors must have or schachenmayr catania abbreviations single_crochet single_crochet increase increase decrease invisible decrease blo back loop only how to use this pattern this pattern uses us terms and is worked in the round you can either work in a spiral or you can join rounds using the slip_stitch chain 1 method please use whichever method you are comfortable with mushroom base instructions in beige round s instructions no of stitches 1 single_crochet 5 into magic_ring 5 2 increase x5 10 3 increase single_crochet x5 15 4 blo single_crochet 15 15 5 decrease single_crochet 3 x3 12 6-7 single_crochet 12 x2 rounds 12 x2 8 blo single_crochet 12 12 9-11 single_crochet 12 x3 rounds 12 x3 12 increase single_crochet x6 18 13 single_crochet increase single_crochet 2 x5 increase single_crochet 24 14 increase single_crochet 3 x6 30 15 single_crochet 30 30 slip_stitch to next stitch to finish or use an invisible join leaving a tail weave in end stuff the stalk medium firmly join beige yarn to first front loop stitch remaining from round 8 crochet into front loops round s instructions no of stitches 1 increase x12 24 slip_stitch to first single_crochet of this round or use an invisible join weave in ends mushroom top instructions in red round s instructions no of stitches 1 single_crochet 6 into magic_ring 6 2 increase x6 12 3 increase single_crochet x6 18 4 single_crochet increase single_crochet 2 x5 increase single_crochet 24 5 increase single_crochet 3 x6 30 6-7 single_crochet 30 x2 rounds 30 x2 slip_stitch to next stitch or use an invisible join leaving a long tail in white add french knots to the right side of the red mushroom top with more knots towards the centre finishing fold over the top lip of the base and insert into the red mushroom top with red yarn tail whip stitch the base and top together threading the needle through the front and back loops of both pieces at the same time see photo add a very small amount of stuffing to the centre before the last few stitches to create the rounded top weave in end to finish tag me in your finished photos on instagram @_alexcrochets_
